verses.verse: Now these are the ordinances <S%H4941><s%> which thou shalt set <S%H7760><s%> before them <S%H6440><s%>.

If thou buy <S%H7069><s%> a Hebrew <S%H5680><s%> servant <S%H5650><s%>, six <S%H8337><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> he shall serve <S%H5647><s%>: and in the seventh <S%H7637><s%> he shall go out <S%H3318><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> for nothing <S%H2600><s%>.

If he come in <S%H935><s%> by himself <S%H1610><s%>, he shall go out <S%H3318><s%> by himself <S%H1610><s%>: if he be married <S%H1167><s%>, then his wife <S%H802><s%> shall go out with him <S%H3318><s%>.

If his master <S%H113><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> him a wife <S%H802><s%>, and she bear <S%H3205><s%> him sons <S%H1121><s%> or daughters <S%H1323><s%>; the wife <S%H802><s%> and her children <S%H1121><s%> shall be her master <S%H113><s%>'s, and he shall go out <S%H3318><s%> by himself <S%H1610><s%>.

But if the servant <S%H5650><s%> shall plainly <S%H559><s%> say <S%H559><s%>, I love <S%H157><s%> my master <S%H113><s%>, my wife <S%H802><s%>, and my children <S%H1121><s%>; I will not go out <S%H3318><s%> free <S%H2670><s%>:

then his master <S%H113><s%> shall bring <S%H5066><s%> him unto God <S%H430><s%>, and shall bring <S%H5066><s%> him to the door <S%H1817><s%>, or unto the door-post <S%H4201><s%>; and his master <S%H113><s%> shall bore <S%H7527><s%> his ear <S%H241><s%> through with an awl <S%H4836><s%>; and he shall serve <S%H5647><s%> him for ever <S%H5769><s%>.
And if a man <S%H376><s%> sell <S%H4376><s%> his daughter <S%H1323><s%> to be a maid-servant <S%H519><s%>, she shall not go out <S%H3318><s%> as the men-servants <S%H5650><s%> do <S%H3318><s%>.

If she please <S%H7451><s%> not her master <S%H113><s%>, who hath espoused <S%H3259><s%> her to himself <S%H6299><s%>, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell <S%H4376><s%> her unto a foreign <S%H5237><s%> people <S%H5971><s%> he shall have no power <S%H4910><s%>, seeing he hath dealt deceitfully with her <S%H898><s%>.
And if he espouse <S%H3259><s%> her unto his son <S%H1121><s%>, he shall deal <S%H6213><s%> with her after the manner <S%H4941><s%> of daughters <S%H1323><s%>.
If he take <S%H3947><s%> him another <S%H312><s%> wife <S%H7607><s%>; her food, her raiment <S%H3682><s%>, and her duty of marriage <S%H5772><s%>, shall he not diminish <S%H1639><s%>.
And if he do <S%H6213><s%> not these three <S%H7969><s%> things unto her <S%H3318><s%>, then shall she go out for nothing <S%H2600><s%>, without money <S%H3701><s%>.
He that smiteth <S%H5221><s%> a man <S%H376><s%>, so that he dieth <S%H4191><s%>, shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.

And if a man lie not in wait <S%H6658><s%>, but God <S%H430><s%> deliver <S%H579><s%> him into his hand <S%H3027><s%>; then I will appoint <S%H7760><s%> thee a place <S%H4725><s%> whither he shall flee <S%H5127><s%>.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> come presumptuously <S%H2102><s%> upon his neighbor <S%H7453><s%>, to slay <S%H2026><s%> him with guile <S%H6195><s%>; thou shalt take <S%H3947><s%> him from mine altar <S%H4196><s%>, that he may die <S%H4191><s%>.
And he that smiteth <S%H5221><s%> his father <S%H1><s%>, or his mother <S%H517><s%>, shall be surely <S%H4191><s%> put to death <S%H4191><s%>.

And he that stealeth <S%H1589><s%> a man <S%H376><s%>, and selleth <S%H4376><s%> him <S%H4672><s%>, or if he be found in his hand <S%H3027><s%>, he shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.
And he that curseth <S%H7043><s%> his father <S%H1><s%> or his mother <S%H517><s%>, shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.

And if men <S%H582><s%> contend <S%H7378><s%>, and one <S%H376><s%> smite <S%H5221><s%> the other <S%H7453><s%> with a stone <S%H68><s%>, or <S%H176><s%> with his fist <S%H106><s%>, and he die <S%H4191><s%> not <S%H5307><s%>, but keep his bed <S%H4904><s%>;

if he rise again <S%H6965><s%>, and walk <S%H1980><s%> abroad <S%H2351><s%> upon his staff <S%H4938><s%>, then shall he that smote <S%H5221><s%> him be quit <S%H5352><s%>: only he shall pay <S%H5414><s%> for the loss of his time <S%H7674><s%>, and shall cause him to be thoroughly <S%H7495><s%> healed <S%H7495><s%>.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> smite <S%H5221><s%> his servant <S%H5650><s%>, or his maid <S%H519><s%>, with a rod <S%H7626><s%>, and he die <S%H4191><s%> under his hand <S%H3027><s%>; he shall surely <S%H5358><s%> be punished <S%H5358><s%>.
Notwithstanding <S%H389><s%>, if he continue <S%H5975><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%> or two <S%H8147><s%>, he shall not be punished <S%H5358><s%>: for he is his money <S%H3701><s%>.

And if men <S%H582><s%> strive <S%H5327><s%> together <S%H5062><s%>, and hurt a woman <S%H802><s%> with child <S%H2030><s%>, so that her fruit <S%H3206><s%> depart <S%H3318><s%>, and yet no harm follow <S%H611><s%>; he shall be surely <S%H6064><s%> fined <S%H6064><s%>, according as the woman <S%H802><s%>'s husband <S%H1167><s%> shall lay <S%H7896><s%> upon him <S%H5414><s%>; and he shall pay as the judges determine <S%H6414><s%>.
But if any harm follow <S%H611><s%>, then thou shalt give <S%H5414><s%> life <S%H5315><s%> for life <S%H5315><s%>,
eye <S%H5869><s%> for eye <S%H5869><s%>, tooth <S%H8127><s%> for tooth <S%H8127><s%>, hand <S%H3027><s%> for hand <S%H3027><s%>, foot <S%H7272><s%> for foot <S%H7272><s%>,
burning <S%H3555><s%> for burning <S%H3555><s%>, wound <S%H6482><s%> for wound <S%H6482><s%>, stripe <S%H2250><s%> for stripe <S%H2250><s%>.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> smite <S%H5221><s%> the eye <S%H5869><s%> of his servant <S%H5650><s%>, or the eye <S%H5869><s%> of his maid <S%H519><s%>, and destroy <S%H7843><s%> it <S%H7971><s%>; he shall let him go free <S%H2670><s%> for <S%H8478><s%> his eye <S%H5869><s%>'s sake.

And if he smite <S%H5307><s%> out his man-servant <S%H5650><s%>'s tooth <S%H8127><s%>, or his maid-servant <S%H519><s%>'s tooth <S%H8127><s%>; he shall let him go <S%H7971><s%> free <S%H2670><s%> for his tooth <S%H8127><s%>'s sake.

And if an ox <S%H7794><s%> gore <S%H5055><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> or a woman <S%H802><s%> to death <S%H7794><s%>, the ox shall be surely <S%H5619><s%> stoned <S%H5619><s%>, and its flesh <S%H1320><s%> shall not be eaten <S%H398><s%>; but the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be quit <S%H5355><s%>.

But if the ox <S%H7794><s%> was wont to gore <S%H5056><s%> in time past <S%H8543><s%>, and it hath been testified <S%H5749><s%> to its owner <S%H1167><s%>, and he hath not kept <S%H8104><s%> it in <S%H4191><s%>, but it hath killed a man <S%H376><s%> or a woman <S%H802><s%>; the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be stoned <S%H5619><s%>, and its owner <S%H1167><s%> also shall be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.
If there be laid <S%H7896><s%> on him a ransom <S%H3724><s%>, then he shall give <S%H5414><s%> for the redemption <S%H6306><s%> of his life <S%H5315><s%> whatsoever is laid upon him <S%H7896><s%>.

Whether it have gored <S%H5055><s%> a son <S%H1121><s%>, or <S%H176><s%> have gored <S%H5055><s%> a daughter <S%H1323><s%>, according to this judgment <S%H4941><s%> shall it be done unto him <S%H6213><s%>.

If the ox <S%H7794><s%> gore <S%H5055><s%> a man-servant <S%H5650><s%> or a maid-servant <S%H519><s%>, there shall be given <S%H5414><s%> unto their master <S%H113><s%> thirty <S%H7970><s%> shekels <S%H8255><s%> of silver <S%H3701><s%>, and the ox <S%H7794><s%> shall be stoned <S%H5619><s%>.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> shall open <S%H6605><s%> a pit <S%H953><s%>, or if a man <S%H376><s%> shall dig <S%H3738><s%> a pit <S%H953><s%> and not cover <S%H3680><s%> it <S%H7794><s%>, and an ox or an ass <S%H2543><s%> fall therein <S%H5307><s%>,

the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the pit <S%H953><s%> shall make it good <S%H7999><s%>; he shall give <S%H7725><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> unto the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof <S%H4191><s%>, and the dead beast shall be his.

And if one man <S%H376><s%>'s ox <S%H7794><s%> hurt <S%H5062><s%> another <S%H7453><s%>'s, so that it dieth <S%H4191><s%>, then they shall sell <S%H4376><s%> the live <S%H2416><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%>, and divide <S%H2673><s%> the price <S%H3701><s%> of it <S%H4191><s%>; and the dead also they shall divide <S%H2673><s%>.

Or if it be known <S%H3045><s%> that the ox <S%H7794><s%> was wont to gore <S%H5056><s%> in time past <S%H8543><s%>, and its owner <S%H1167><s%> hath not kept <S%H8104><s%> it in <S%H7999><s%>; he shall surely pay <S%H7999><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> for ox <S%H7794><s%>, and the dead beast shall be his own <S%H4191><s%>.
